abstracts.cdata!:
In Vietnam, all communities in the
            survey (both inland and coastal) represent poor
            hamlets/communes, with a high incidence of poor households:
            61 percent in Vinh Tuong hamlet (Ninh Thuan), 52 percent and
            42.6 percent in Thach Hai and Tuong Son hamlets (Ha Tinh)
            respectively, over 23 percent in Hiep My Dong and My Nam
            Long hamlets (Tra Vinh). Progress with poverty reduction has
            been slow in these communities. Kinh people are the majority
            as compared with other ethnic groups in surveyed
            communities; only 2 communes in Quang Ninh (Duong Hoa and
            Quang Dien) have a small number of ethnic minority people
            such as San Diu, Tay, Nung, Chinese; a large number of
            ethnic Khmer was observed in My Long Nam and Hiep My Dong
            communes in Tra Vinh Province. This paper contains the
            following: chapter 1 introduction with summary, objectives,
            method, selection of area, and the stakeholders; chapter 2
            findings from the communities - the coastal and inland water
            areas' characteristics in Vietnam; chapter 3 livelihood
            opportunities for fishing communities; chapter 4 role of
            market and other assistance to poor fisherman communities;
            and chapter 5 recommended strategy to support poor fisherman communities.
